feat.name: Blood Hound
entries: Your senses are heightened beyond those of most folk. Whether these senses were strengthened through training or the loss of other senses, or they simply matured as you did, you are a master of finding those whom you seek. You  gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Motion Sensor
entries: Whenever a creature that is Small or larger moves within 10 feet of you while you do not have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition, you immediately become aware of its presence.

entries.name: No Hiding
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on sound or smell.

feat.name: Convincing Inquisitor
entries: You know how to spot a liar, and you can get people to see your way, whether through charm, reasonable arguments, or force of will. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Charming Presence
entries: When you take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action, you don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on checks to influence {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} creatures, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on checks to influence {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} creatures.

entries.name: Multiple Paths
entries: You can use any ability modifier when you take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action to make an {@skill Intimidation|XPHB} or  {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} check.

entries.name: Zealous Insight
entries: When you succeed on a {@action Search|XPHB} action's Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check to detect lies or evasive answers, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls involving combat against that creature for 1 hour.

feat.name: Deathbound
entries: You have seen death many times, up close and personal, and sometimes at your own hand. These experiences have affected you deeply, teaching you about life and death. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: One Last Breath
entries: If you have two {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failures, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Death Saving Throws until you are no longer at 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Recuperation
entries: When you spend a {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} to recover {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can roll the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die twice and use the higher roll.

feat.name: Fortune of the Thaumaturge
entries: Your connection to the Thaumaturge puts you in touch with forces outside mortal understanding, making others think you were born under a fortunate moon. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Fortune's Fortitude
entries: When you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can expend and roll one {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die, adding that number to your result. You can do this only once per {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}.
You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all uses of this ability when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fortune of the Unknown
entries: When using the Fortune's Fortitude benefit, if you roll the highest or lowest number on the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die, you regain that {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die. It still counts as a use of Fortune's Fortitude.

feat.name: Free Sword Mercenary's Will
entries: Your training with the Company of Free Swords has given you an increased stamina and an attitude that make you less likely to succumb to hardships. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hold the Ground
entries: When you are moved without using your movement by a creature, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the distance you are moved by up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Resolute
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws that would apply a condition.

feat.name: Insightful Collector
entries: Your expeditions, transactions, and mercantile activities on behalf of the Augustine Trading Company have put you in contact with collectors of historical artifacts, relics, and tomes. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Object Intuition
entries: You can take a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine one magical object and learn its properties and how to use it without attuning to it or taking a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} in physical contact with it, but you don't learn any curse the item might bear. There is a cumulative 5% chance for every rarity above Common that you misidentify the nature and the power of the object.

entries.name: Rare Find
entries: You begin play in possession of a Common magic item. Work with your GM to decide on which object fits your character and the campaign.

feat.name: Resolution of the Syndicate
entries: Membership in the Ebon Syndicate provides perks—one of which is the motivation that comes with the understanding that the Syndicate kills those who fail too often. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Quick Strike
entries: On your first turn after an {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll, add {@dice 1d4} to the first damage roll you make. This extra damage increases to {@dice 2d4} at character level 9, and to {@dice 4d4} at character level 16.

entries.name: Resilient
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by an amount equal to your character level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a character level thereafter, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by an additional 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

feat.name: Survivor
entries: Your ability to make the best out of a bad situation has served you well. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hardy
entries: You need half the amount of food per day based on your size.

entries.name: Intuitive
entries: When you take the {@action Study|XPHB} action, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence checks made when taking the {@action Study|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Shake It Off
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, if any, decreases by 1. Additionally, when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level decreases by 2.

feat.name: Triage Expert
entries: You are trained in dealing with injuries on the battlefield, and with the saving of lives afterward. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bedside Manner
entries: Whenever you cause a creature to regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or the Blood and Bone benefit, you can roll one extra die and discard the lowest die.

entries.name: Blood and Bone
entries: Taking the Utilize action and expending the use of a {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB} lets you heal a creature within 5 feet of you. The creature can expend and roll a {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die and regain that number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

feat.name: Blackpowder Pistol Expert
entries: You have become practiced with the use of Blackpowder Pistols. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Deadeye
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with a Blackpowder Pistol.

entries.name: Quick Load
entries: You ignore {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading} of the Blackpowder Pistol.

entries.name: Trick Shot
entries: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you moves, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a ranged attack with a Blackpowder Pistol against that creature.

feat.name: Expanded Grip
entries: Your natural ability with larger weapons lets you use them in a way others can't. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: One-Handed Grip
entries: When you use a Versatile weapon with one hand, the weapon deals the damage in parentheses when used to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Zealous Grasp
entries: If an effect forces you to drop what you are holding, you can make a DC 15 Strength saving throw to maintain your grip. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a saving throw to maintain your grip, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.

feat.name: Hulking Figure
entries: Either from extensive training or a natural build, you have a broad and formidable size for your species. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Brutal
entries: Once per turn, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d4} Bludgeoning damage to a target you hit with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

entries.name: Intimidating
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Performance|XPHB}, or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check, you can also add your Strength modifier to the roll.

entries.name: Powerful
entries: You count as one size larger (to a maximum size of Large) when determining your carrying capacity.

feat.name: Iron Gut
entries: You can eat like a hill giant and drink like a fish. Years of punishing your stomach and liver have led to a powerful fortitude. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Inured to Poison
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Everything Looks Delicious
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) checks to forage for food.

entries.name: Quick to Recover
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one of your {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, roll the die and add your Constitution modifier, and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll's total. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Lightning Caster
entries: Your rapid-fire style of casting cantrips allows you to weave magic with uncanny speed. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dual Target
entries: When you cast a cantrip with a casting time of an action that targets a single creature, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to target a second creature within the cantrip's range.

entries.name: Immediate Response
entries: When you cast a spell as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, that spell doesn't expend a spell slot. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Medician of the Morbus Doctore
entries: You are a master of the medical sciences because of your association with a medical institute. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Adept Medic
entries: When you use the Blood and Bone benefit of the Triage Expert feat, the creature can spend up to three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} instead of one.

entries.name: Battle Surgeon
entries: When you use the Blood and Bone benefit of the Triage Expert feat, the creature can spend three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} to end one of the following conditions on itself instead of regaining {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, or {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.
Alternatively, you can cure one Grievous Wound affecting the creature (see Grim Hollow {@variantrule Campaign|XPHB} Guide).

feat.name: Nimble Physique
entries: You are small and thin for your species. You have a mysterious and consistent ability to avoid danger. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Dodgy
entries: While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a {@item Shield|XPHB}, you can take the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

items.name: Slippery
entries: While you are {@condition Grappled|XPHB} or {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, your attacks don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} and attacks against you don't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

feat.name: Sangromantic Initiate
entries: You have become adept enough with weaving blood magic to mitigate some of the harm of Sangromancy. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Blood Magic
entries: Choose a Sangromancy spell from any spell list of a level for which you have spell slots. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slot you have.

entries.name: Sanguine Potency
entries: You have a pool of two d12s that you can expend instead of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} when you cast Sangromancy spells. Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Shadowsteel Adept
entries: You have learned to tap into the dangerous but powerful art of Shadowsteel casting. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Curse Caster
entries: You always have Shadowsteel curses prepared, and you can cast them with any spell slots you have.

entries.name: Shadowsteel's Bite
entries: While holding your Shadowsteel Focus, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.

entries.name: Shadowsteel Weapon
entries: If your Shadowsteel Focus is also a weapon, that weapon has a +1 bonus to weapon attack rolls and damage rolls.

feat.name: Shadowsteel Master
entries: Your mastery over Shadowsteel grows stronger. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Necrotic Harmony
entries: While holding your Shadowsteel Focus, when you cast a spell that targets one or more creatures and requires an attack roll or saving throw, you can choose one target you hit or who failed the saving throw to also take {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage for each spell slot level expended to cast the spell.

entries.name: Necrotic Weapon
entries: If your Shadowsteel Focus is also a weapon, that weapon has a +2 bonus to weapon attack rolls and damage rolls. Additionally, once on each of your turns, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack roll using your Shadowsteel Focus, you can cause the target to take an extra {@damage 2d8} Necrotic damage.

feat.name: Syndicate Spy
entries: Rising in the ranks of the Ebon Syndicate has taught you the clandestine skills of spycraft, valuable in your trade as a racketeer. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Locksmith
entries: You have proficiency with {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}. While holding {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, you can craft a key to a lock by spending 10 minutes with that lock.

entries.name: Master of Disguise
entries: You have proficiency with a {@item Disguise Kit|XPHB}. If you spend 10 minutes donning a {@item Costume|XPHB},  you decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and other distinguishing characteristics. You can make yourself appear as a member of another species, though none of your statistics change. You can't appear as a creature of a different size, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this benefit to become quadrupedal, for instance.

entries.name: Master Calligrapher
entries: You have proficiency with a {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB}. You aren't limited to 10 or fewer words when mimicking someone else's handwriting.

entries.name: Blending In
entries: When using the {@action Hide|XPHB} action to conceal yourself from creatures that aren't {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you, you need only be {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB} and you may use Charisma instead of Dexterity for the check.

feat.name: Thrown Weapon Master
entries: You excel at thrown weapons. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Multithrow
entries: After you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to make a ranged attack roll using a Simple weapon that has {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown}, you can make two additional ranged attacks using Simple weapons that have {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Quick Hands
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can retrieve and stow or wield all Simple weapons with {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} that are within 5 feet of you. You need a free hand to perform this maneuver.

entries.name: Returning
entries: Simple weapons with {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} that you are proficient with also have the Returning property (see Chapter 8: Advanced Weapons & Equipment).

feat.name: Witch Hunter
entries: You have honed and perfected your skills fighting against spellcasters, possibly from your background hunting mages as part of the Arcanist Inquisition. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dodge Spells
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to avoid a spell that is targeting only you and doesn't create an area of effect. Make a Wisdom saving throw against the spellcaster's spell save DC. On a successful save, the creature must choose a new target or the spell is canceled. A canceled spell dissipates with no effect, and any resources used to cast it are wasted.

entries.name: Keep Your Enemies Close
entries: When you hit a target that can cast spells with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can reduce its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} by 15 feet until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Resist Curses
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against all Shadowsteel curses, and also against spells with a duration of more than 10 minutes.

feat.name: Advanced Weapon Proficiency
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Weapon Proficiency
entries: You have proficiency with Advanced weapons, and your training allows you to use the mastery properties of those weapons.

entries.name: Special
entries: This feat can be taken as a General feat by a character of level 8 or higher.

feat.name: Close Combat Artillerist
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Firing in Melee
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.

entries.name: Point Blank
entries: When you hit a creature that is within 5 feet of you with a ranged attack, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

feat.name: Dual Shot
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dual Shot
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and attack with a bow or crossbow, you can make one extra attack as part of the same action against a creature that is within 10 feet of the original target that is within the weapon's range. If you do so, both attacks are made with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

feat.name: Flurry
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Quick Strike
entries: Once on each of your turns when you make an attack roll with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll, you can forgo {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on that attack roll. After resolving that attack, you can then make another attack with the same weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against a different creature. The new target must be within 5 feet of the first target and within the weapon's reach.

feat.name: Mobile Combatant
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Slippery
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet and {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you until the end of your turn.

feat.name: Opportunist
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Exploit Weakness
entries: Whenever you make an attack as part of a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack and damage rolls.

feat.name: Prone Defense
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Defensive
entries: When you have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls. {@action Attack|XPHB} roll against you doesn't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} because of the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Hop Up
entries: When you have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you can right yourself with only 5 feet of movement.

feat.name: Boon of the Archlich
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Vessel of Vitality
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, if your Soul Vessel is not charged, it gains a soul and becomes charged.

feat.name: Boon of the Ascended Vampire
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Inured to Sunlight
entries: You are no longer affected by sunlight.

feat.name: Boon of the Earthly Tether
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Persistent Haunter
entries: You are no longer affected by the Fraying Reality Transformation Flaw.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any Specter Transformation Boon that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of the Elder Horror
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Stabilizing Form
entries: When you roll a 25 or lower on the Unstable Form table, you can choose to roll again. You must use the new result. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any Aberrant Horror Transformation Boon that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of the Elder Fey
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Fey Bulwark
entries: You are no longer affected by the Weakened Constitution Transformation Flaw.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any Fey Transformation Boon that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

entries.name: Free Agent
entries: You are no longer affected by the Pull of The Netherworld Transformation Flaw.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any Fiend Transformation Boon that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of the Elemental Temperance
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Controlled Chaos
entries: You are no longer affected by the Primordial Chaos Transformation Flaw.

feat.name: Boon of the High Seraph
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Absolution
entries: You are no longer affected by the Seraph Corruption Transformation Flaw.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any Seraph Transformation Boon that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of Magic Resistance
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Heroic Resistance
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can cause yourself to succeed instead. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Boon of Perfect Flight
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Flying
entries: You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 40 feet and can hover. Graceful Fall. If you fall more than 5 feet, your rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until you land.

feat.name: Boon of Shadowsteel Mastery
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Strange Bedfellows
entries: You are no longer affected by the Friendless Transformation Flaw.

feat.name: Boon of the Wilds
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Apex Predator
entries: When you enter your Hybrid Form, you gain 25 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. At the end of each of your turns while in Hybrid Form, if you have no Tempo- rary {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you gain 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. While you are in your Hybrid Form and have no Temporary Hit points, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls.

itemMastery.name: Brutal
entries: A Brutal weapon is designed for maximum damage. Brutal weapons score Critical Hits on a natural roll of 19 or 20. If your Critical Range is already increased, instead increase it by 1 point (such as from 19-20 to 18-20).
When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with a Brutal weapon against a creature, the weapon deals one additional die of damage.

itemMastery.name: Defending
entries: A Defending weapon is either made for parrying, has advanced techniques for use in parrying, or both. When wielding a Defending weapon, you may use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you are hit by a melee attack roll. Roll {@dice 1d4} and add the result to your AC, including against the triggering attack.

itemMastery.name: Disarming
entries: A Disarming weapon can catch a foe's weapon, allowing you to remove it from their grasp. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and hit with a Disarming weapon, you can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later on the same turn to disarm the target. Both you and the attacker must make opposed attack rolls, ignoring any sources of {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} and {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}. If your result is higher and the weapon is something the target can drop, the weapon falls from the target's grasp, landing in its space.

If your winning result on the opposed attack roll was a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}, you can choose for the weapon either to land in a space of your choice up to 15 feet from the target, or to land in your hand if you have a free hand.

itemMastery.name: Entangling
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and hit with an Entangling weapon, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later on the same turn to entangle the target. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 10 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or have the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition until it escapes or until you release the weapon. The target succeeds automatically if it is Huge or larger.

To escape, the target must use an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics|XPHB}) check against the same DC. On a success, the target no longer has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition. While a creature is {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by this weapon, you can't use it to attack a different creature.

itemMastery.name: Returning
entries: A Returning weapon allows you to hurl the weapon in such a way that it returns to you. When you make a ranged attack with a Returning weapon, the weapon returns to you immediately after hitting or missing the target. You can catch the weapon if you have a hand free to do so.

itemMastery.name: Scatter
entries: Scatter weapons can devastate multiple enemies at once. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and hit a creature with a Scatter weapon, measure the weapon's scatter range from the target's space (or one square the creature occupies if it is Large or larger). Creatures other than the original target that fall within the weapon's scatter range take damage equal to your 1 + your Dexterity modifier (minimum 2). This damage is of the same type you dealt to the original target.

itemMastery.name: Set
entries: Weapons with the Set property allow you to prepare for an oncoming attack. If a target enters your reach while you wield a weapon with this property, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a melee attack with the weapon against that target.

itemMastery.name: Strong-Draw
entries: A weapon with the Strong-Draw quality requires great strength to use. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls with a Strong-Draw weapon unless your Strength is 13 or higher. You add both your Strength and Dexterity modifiers to damage with a Strong-Draw weapon.

itemMastery.name: Swift
entries: Swift weapons help you recover quickly from missed attacks. When you miss with a Swift weapon, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack roll you make with the weapon against the same target before the end of your next turn. If that attack hits, it also deals an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the weapon's normal damage type.

monster.name: Fleshling Construct
languages: understands the languages known by the target Challenge None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

action.name: Strangle
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 2d8 + summonSpellLevel} Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape DC equals your spell save DC) and can't speak. Until the grapple ends, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and is {@hazard Suffocation|XPHB|suffocating}.

action.name: Constrict
entries: The fleshling construct constricts a target that it is grappling, doing {@damage 2d8 + summonSpellLevel} Bludgeoning damage.

spell.name: Arboreal Curse
entries: You attempt to turn one creature that you can see within range into wood. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition as its flesh begins to harden into bark. On a successful save, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the start of your next turn.

A creature {@condition Restrained|XPHB} by this spell makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the condition ends. If it fails three times, it is turned into a tree and has the {@condition Petrified|XPHB} condition. The successes and failures needn't be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.
If the creature is burned, chopped down, or otherwise destroyed while {@condition Petrified|XPHB}, it is killed.

A creature remains transformed unless the effect is reversed within 1 year with {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Wish|XPHB}, or similar magic. If the creature spends 1 year and 1 day as a tree, the transformation becomes permanent, and nothing can return the creature to its original form.

spell.name: Arcane Aegis
entries: When you cast this spell, you are surrounded by a shimmering light that quickly dissipates. You gain {@dice 2d10} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. If a creature hits you with a melee attack before the spell ends, the creature takes Force damage equal to the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} lost as a result of the attack. The spell ends early if you have no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You gain an additional {@dice 2d10} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Assisted Aim
entries: You invigorate up to three creatures within range with improved accuracy. Each target gains a +1 bonus to attack rolls it makes with Ranged weapons. Additionally, the normal and long range of Ranged weapons wielded by a target are doubled for the spell's duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Binding Pledge

components.m: a book of religious or legal importance

entries: When you cast the spell, a willing creature within range makes a promise, swears an oath, or enters into a contract. For the duration of the spell, you immediately know if the creature breaks that promise, oath, or contract. If this happens, for the remainder of the duration of the spell, you know the distance and direction to the creature. If this spell is dispelled, you immediately know it but don't learn the distance and direction to the creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The duration becomes 30 days (level 3-4 slot) or 1 year (level 5-6 slot). If you use a level 7+ spell slot, the spell lasts until dispelled.

spell.name: Bloat
entries: You cause the gases within a creature you can see within range to expand rapidly. The target makes a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. If the damage that the creature takes equals or exceeds its Constitution ability score, the creature floats vertically 5 feet and remains suspended until the start of your next turn. The target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing. When the spell ends, the target floats gently to the ground.

spell.name: Bloodbane Rune
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die or the spell automatically fails. You target a weapon of your choice within range and scrawl onto it a rune written in blood.

For the duration, while you wield this weapon, it weeps a phantasmal red ichor when within 30 feet of an Undead creature. Additionally, once per turn, when you damage an Undead creature with the weapon, you deal extra Radiant damage. To determine this damage, roll the number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} you expended to cast the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You expend an additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die for each spell slot level above 1. In addition, your {@status Concentration|XPHB} can last longer with a spell slot of level 2 (up to 10 minutes) or 3+ (up to 1 hour).

spell.name: Bloodletter
entries: You touch a nonmagical weapon. Until the spell ends, the first creature hit by the weapon must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or receive a festering wound. A creature with a festering wound takes {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns for the spell's duration. A creature can only have one festering wound at a time.
If the creature receives healing, the spell and recurring damage end.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot above 2.

spell.name: Blood Bond

components.m: a rag soaked in your own blood

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the expended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, and the target gains a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll's total.

For the duration, you know the direction and distance to the target, and you and the target can speak telepathically. Additionally, you can target that creature when you cast a spell with a range of Self or Touch, regardless of the distance between you. These benefits are suppressed while you and the creature are not on the same plane.

At any point, the targeted creature can choose to end the spell early. If it does, the creature loses all remaining {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by this spell and takes Necrotic damage equal to the {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} lost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The duration increases with a spell slot level 5 or 6 (8 hours), 7 or 8 (24 hours), and 9 (7 days).

spell.name: Blood Tide
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend six {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails.

A gout of blood forming a 100-foot-long, 10-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed 100 feet away from you in a direction following the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}, has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, and takes Bludgeoning damage equal to a roll of the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended on the spell plus your spellcasting ability modifier. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend one additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die for each spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Blood Rush
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die twice, and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the added roll plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend one additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Blood Wisp
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell and create a red wisp with a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll plus your spellcasting ability modifier. The wisp circles your head. It has an AC equal to 10 plus your spellcasting ability modifier, and uses your saving throws.

Each time you roll damage for a spell while the wisp circles you, you can reroll one of the damage dice. You must use the new roll, and the wisp takes damage equal to the new roll. If the wisp is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend one additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Boil Blood
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die or the spell automatically fails. A willing target takes Fire damage equal to a roll of the expended {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die. If the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, that condition immediately ends.

spell.name: Burst Forth
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend seven {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. You teleport inside a creature that you can see within range and burst forth from it in a fountain of gore in the nearest unoccupied space. The target makes a Constitution saving throw, taking Necrotic damage equal to a roll of the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell plus your spellcasting ability modifier on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend one additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die for each spell slot level above 7.

spell.name: Calling Card

components.m: a stamp carved like the mark left by your calling card

entries: You touch a corpse and leave a magical mark. You can choose to make it a visible mark that appears as a rune or word written on the flesh, or you can choose to make the mark {@condition Invisible|XPHB}. A creature that takes the {@action Study|XPHB} action to specifically examine a corpse automatically detects it, whether visible or {@condition Invisible|XPHB}.

spell.name: Call the Rabid Beast

components.m: a fang from a rabid animal

entries: A creature you touch transforms into a rabid monster, filled with primal fury. The target sprouts thick fur and its mouth elongates into a fanged maw. It gains 20 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. While transformed, the creature has the following effects:

items: It has an {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} of 17 if its AC is lower than that.
It has a +5 bonus on damage rolls with Strengthbased attacks.
It can make a Bite attack as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. The Bite deals {@damage 1d6} + its Strength modifier Slashing damage.
It has immunity to the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.
It can't cast spells or maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

At the start of each of its turns, it must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or lose control until the spell ends. A creature that loses control must take an {@action Attack|XPHB} action on each of its turns, using melee attacks against the nearest creature. If none are within reach, the creature must use its movement, and if necessary the {@action Dash|XPHB} action, to move toward the nearest creature.

spell.name: Chains of Beleth
entries: Barbed chains ending in meat hooks burst from the ground from a point you can see within range, flailing in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point.
Each creature in the area makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 8d6} Piercing damage and has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the spell ends.

The first time a creature enters the chain's area on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition while in the area or until it breaks free. A creature {@condition Restrained|XPHB} by the chains can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition Restrained|XPHB}.
When a creature {@condition Restrained|XPHB} by this spell ends its turn, the creature takes {@damage 3d6} Bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The initial and subsequent damage increase by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Circle of Scarlet

components.m: a piece of parchment with a circle drawn in humanoid blood

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend four {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. A crimson pillar erupts from the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 100-foot-high {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder} centered on a point within range. Each creature within the {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder} makes a Constitution saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature takes Necrotic damage equal to a roll of the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended on the spell plus your spellcasting ability modifier. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.
For each creature that fails the saving throw against this spell, you gain 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

spell.name: Conjure Plants
entries: You conjure animated plants that appear as a Large mass of vines, stems, shoots, roots, and leaves in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The vegetation lasts for the duration.

While you're within 5 feet of the plants or sharing a space with them, you are considered to be in a {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB} area. Other creatures cannot enter the same space as the plants. When you move on your turn, you can also move the plants up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Whenever the plants move within 5 feet of a creature you can see, and whenever a creature you can see enters a space within 5 feet of the plants or ends its turn there, you can force that creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d6} Slashing damage. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Consume Mind

components.m: a 1-ounce fresh or magically preserved portion of another creature's brain

entries: You consume the brain of a dead creature, gaining access to its memories. The creature must have a brain and can't be Undead. The spell fails if the creature has been dead (and not preserved) for more than 3 days.

Until the spell ends, you can attempt to recall a memory, such as family history, recent events, building layouts, passwords, details of the creature's death, and similar information. To recall a memory, you take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and make an ability check using your spellcasting ability modifier. The DC equals the corpse's Intelligence ability score.
Once you take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to recall information, you can't attempt to recall that specific piece of information again.

spell.name: Consumption
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die or the spell automatically fails. Choose a creature within range and roll the expended {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die. The target takes Necrotic damage equal to the result. At the end of each of its turns while the spell lasts, the target makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes this damage again. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Creeping Death
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend eight {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the expended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}. The target's Creeping Death threshold is equal to the roll's total. For the spell's duration, if the creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} are reduced to or lower than its Creeping Death threshold, the creature immediately dies.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, roll {@dice 2d6} and add the result to the creature's Creeping Death threshold. On a successful save, add half the result instead. If the creature succeeds on three saving throws, which don't have to be consecutive, this spell ends early.

spell.name: Creeping Touch
entries: You detach your hand at the wrist, transforming it into a {@creature Spider|XMM}. While the spider is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can see through its eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn. During this time, you have no awareness of your own surroundings.

If the spider is killed or doesn't return to you before the spell ends, your hand is restored, but you take {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can command the spider to return to you. Once it arrives, it reattaches as your hand and the spell ends.

spell.name: Crimson Lash
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die or the spell automatically fails. A writhing lash of coagulated blood springs from your hand with the following properties:

items: It counts as a Simple weapon with which you are proficient.
It has the Light, Finesse, and Reach properties.
You can use your spellcasting ability modifier instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls with this weapon.
Its damage die is the same as the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die expended to cast the spell, and the damage dealt is Necrotic.
Each time a creature takes damage from this weapon, its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell using a level 3-4 spell slot, you can make two weapon attacks with this weapon when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action. If you use a level 5+ spell slot, you can make three weapon attacks with this weapon when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action.

spell.name: Crown of Radiance
entries: A flaming crown of holy light adorns your head until the spell ends. A Fiend, Fey, or Undead that moves within 30 feet of you or begins its turn within 30 feet of you takes {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage.
The crown sheds {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 30 feet.

spell.name: Dark Sacrament

m.text: a dagger encrusted in jewels worth 100+ GP

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend four {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet using the Material component of this spell. On a hit, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell plus {@dice 4d8}. You deal Necrotic damage equal to the roll's total. If this damage causes the creature to be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it immediately dies and you gain one of the following dark blessings of your choice. When you take Radiant damage while you have a dark blessing, you take an extra {@damage 1d4} Radiant damage.

entries.name: Unassailable
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all saving throws.

entries.name: Unbreakable
entries: Your size increases by one category (from Medium to Large, for example), you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1) at the start of each of your turns, and your weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage.

entries.name: Unerring
entries: Your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} increases by 2. Your dark blessing ends after 10 minutes or when you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, whichever happens first.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The initial damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Dazing Blast
entries: A wave of force leaves your palms, targeting a creature within range. The target makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} Force damage and has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes the damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: One additional creature can be targeted for each spell slot above 2.

spell.name: Earth Worm
entries: You transform the earth into a wormlike maw at an unoccupied point on the ground within range. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the worm. On a hit, the target takes Piercing damage equal to {@dice 3d8} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, it has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes {@damage 6d6} Bludgeoning damage at the start of each of your turns.

A creature trapped within the worm can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is regurgitated and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the worm.
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can move the worm up to 30 feet.

spell.name: Elemental Exhalation
entries: When you cast this spell, choose one of the following effects that determine the spell's damage type:

items.name: Air
entries: The damage type is Thunder. Each creature that fails the saving throw is pushed 10 feet away from you.

items.name: Coldfire
entries: The damage type is Cold. Each creature that fails the saving throw has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Earth
entries: The damage type is Bludgeoning. Each creature that fails the saving throw has its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Fire
entries: The damage type is Fire. Each creature that fails the saving throw is engulfed in flames and takes {@damage 2d6} Fire damage at the end of its next turn. As an action, it can extinguish fire on itself by giving itself the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and rolling on the ground. The fire also goes out if it is doused, submerged, or suffocated.

items.name: Water
entries: The damage type is Acid. Each creature that fails the saving throw has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

Each creature within a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} of destructive elemental energy must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 5d6} damage of the chosen type. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Emmeline's Essence Infusion

m.text: a diamond vial containing at least one ounce of blood worth at least 100 GP, which this spell consumes

entries: When you cast this spell, you target one nonmagical weapon within range. That weapon becomes magical and gains a special benefit based on the creature type of the blood used as the Material component for this spell. The item requires {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}, and only the creature attuned to this weapon gains these benefits.

entries.name: Aberration
entries: Your attacks with weapons deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage on a hit. In addition, you can telepathically speak with any creature that has taken at least 1 point of damage from this weapon in the last 24 hours, provided you are both on the same plane.

entries.name: Celestial
entries: Your attacks with weapons deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage on a hit. In addition, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cause the weapon to shed {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 30 feet. You can end this effect by using another {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Dragon
entries: Your attack rolls with this weapon can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}. In addition, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Fey
entries: Your attacks with weapons deal an extra {@damage 1d4} Force damage on a hit. In addition, once per turn when you hit a creature within 30 feet with this weapon, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of it.

entries.name: Fiend
entries: Your attacks with weapons deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage on a hit. You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to change this extra damage to Cold or Fire.

When you cast this spell, you attune to the magic weapon. The spell's duration lasts as long as you have {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to the weapon. During the spell's duration, the magic item is susceptible to the {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} spell. If you maintain {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to the magic weapon for 1 year, the enchantment becomes permanent and this spell ends.

spell.name: Enspelled Armament

components.m: a vial of oil and water

entries: When you cast this spell, choose one Simple or Martial weapon. A replica of the chosen weapon, made of iridescent energy, appears in your hands. For the duration, you are proficient with that weapon and whenever you attack with the weapon, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. Attacks made with this weapon don't require ammunition, and if you throw the weapon as part of a ranged attack, it returns to your hand immediately after resolving the attack. The damage dealt by this weapon is Force instead of the weapon's normal damage type.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage of the weapon increases by {@dice 1d4} for each spell slot level above 2. If you cast the spell using a level 5+ spell slot, the duration becomes 8 hours.

spell.name: Extract Iron
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend three Hit Dice or the spell automatically fails. Roll the expended Hit Dice and extract a number of pounds of iron from your blood equal to the roll's total.

You fashion this iron into nonmagical metal objects. The combined weight of these objects must be equal to or less than the number rolled on the expended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}. The quality of these created objects is poor but functional.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend an additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die and create additional iron for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Fiend Flesh
entries: You touch a willing creature, transforming its skin into red scales. Until the spell ends, the target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold, Fire, and Lightning damage, and the target also has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage.

spell.name: Flash Fever
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The creature breaks into a cold sweat and makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the cold sweat becomes a burning fever and the creature takes {@damage 4d6} Fire damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

For the duration, at the start of the target's turn, it takes {@damage 2d6} Fire damage. The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, the spell ends. If the target fails three of the saves, it takes {@damage 8d6} Fire damage and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Flense
entries: You target a creature you can see within range, using necromantic force to slice the skin from its body. Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to force the same target to make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 8d6} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The spell ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range, if the target is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, or if you can't see it.

spell.name: Fleshcrawl
entries: You rip the flesh from a creature, fashioning it into a twisted monstrosity of blood and skin that rises up to attack the creature.

A creature that you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 8d10} Necrotic damage. The creature's flayed skin is animated as a grotesque mockery. It uses the {@creature Fleshling Construct|GrimHollowPG24} stat block. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its movement to avoid danger. The fleshling disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Frightful Start
entries: You twist your visage to scare a creature that you can see within range. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Ghost Light
entries: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension and specify any number of creatures you can see within 10 feet. Until the spell ends, the object sheds silvery {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 20-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 20 feet. This light is only visible to the creatures you specified during the casting of the spell; all other creatures perceive the area affected by the light as they regularly would.

spell.name: Greater Animate Dead

m.text: a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, a pinch of bone dust, and a black onyx stone worth 75+ GP for each level of CR you animate

entries: Choose a number of corpses, within range. You can reanimate up to 5 {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} 2 or lower Undead creatures from these corpses.

On each of your turns, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 120 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete. The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which time it stops obeying any command you've given it.

To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four creatures you have animated with this spell rather than animating a new creature. Additionally, casting this spell in this manner doesn't require spell components with a GP cost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can animate one additional Undead creature for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Heartseeker
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend six {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Blood flows from your body then crystallizes into a barbed arrow, which launches at a creature. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within range. On a hit, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell, and the creature takes Piercing damage equal to the numbered rolled.

Once lodged in the creature, the bloody arrow begins to burrow toward its heart, rendering it susceptible to injury. Until the spell ends, the first successful attack against a creature after its turn ends each round is automatically a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

The target makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failed save, the effect continues. On a success save, the creature takes {@damage 3d8} Necrotic damage and the spell ends.

spell.name: Holy Word
entries: You whisper a divine word under your breath, careful not to speak loudly, for such celestial power isn't for the unworthy. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Radiant damage. If the target is Fey, Fiend, or Undead, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced by 10 feet and it can't take Reactions until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Hunter Sense
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target's senses are heightened. Whenever the target makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check, it can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

spell.name: Illusory Instrument
entries: You create an illusionary copy of a mundane {@item musical instrument|XPHB}. The copy of the instrument takes on the shape of your fondest memory of the instrument, such as the first {@item flute|XPHB} you owned or the half harp gifted to you by a loved one. This illusion moves as its physical counterpart would, but it is weightless and is tangible only to you. This instrument can be used as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}. This illusory instrument dissipates if you move 10 feet away from it orchoose to end the spell (no action required by you).
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can command your instrument to create one of the following effects:

items: Mimic basic sounds heard on a daily basis, such as a bird chirping, footsteps, or a slamming door.
Automatically play a basic beat at the tempo of your choice.
Record anything played on it, and play it back on a loop.
Record and playback any noise that it could pick up within 15 feet, such as conversation, a royal decree, or a snoring party member who swears that they don't snore.

spell.name: Incite Riot
entries: When you cast this spell, you wave the red handkerchief used as the Material component and choose any number of creatures within range that can see you. Each chosen creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. It does so with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} if you or your allies are fighting it. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} creature is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your allies. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, it must use its action to make melee attacks against the nearest creature (other than you or your allies) or use its turn to move toward the nearest target.
At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

spell.name: Intaglio

components.m: a quill or a vial of ink

entries: You create a duplicate of a text or image. During the spell's duration, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to trace your hand over any non-magical text or image on a surface within range. You copy the text or image onto a new medium that you provide, such as another book or parchement. This spell copies a single page with each {@action Magic|XPHB} action. When copying a spellbook, you can do so using the same method as you would replace a spellbook, except the time and GP requirements are both halved.

spell.name: Investiture of Venom
entries: Until the spell ends, your veins bulge and become visibly green beneath your skin, your eyes weep constantly with liquid poison, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage and the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

You can determine if creatures you can see within 30 feet of you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature makes a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature loses {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage, {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage, or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, a {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} of venom 15 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} Poison damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

spell.name: Lifesink
entries: An aura extends from you in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} for the duration. Any other creature that enters or begins its turn in the area takes {@damage 4d6} Necrotic damage. At the start of your turn, you regain {@dice 4d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} plus 1 for each creature in the area.

spell.name: Life Tether
entries: Choose a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a sickly green tether forms between you and your target. Whenever you take damage, the tethered target takes half as much damage (round down) as Necrotic damage. If the target drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} before this spell ends, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to move the tether to a new creature you can see within range. The new target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be tethered.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can create additional tethers with a spell slot of level 4 (two tethers), 6 (three tethers), or 8 (four tethers).

spell.name: Little Death

m.text: an item of personal sentimental value worth 1+ SP

entries: When you cast this spell, you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and die. At the start of your next turn, you become a {@creature Ghost|XMM} occupying the same space as your corpse. Your game statistics are replaced by the {@creature Ghost|XMM|Ghost's} stat block, but you retain your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}; {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; and languages.

While you are a {@creature Ghost|XMM}, you can only use abilities detailed in the {@creature Ghost|XMM|Ghost's} stat block. In addition, you add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to your attack rolls and the DC of your {@creature Ghost|XMM} abilities.

Your GM secretly rolls {@dice 1d8} when you cast the spell. After a number of hours equal to the number rolled, the spell ends. The spell ends early if you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as a {@creature Ghost|XMM} or you take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to end the spell. If the Material component used to cast this spell remains on your corpse, you return to life with a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum. If the Material component used to cast this spell is no longer on your corpse, you die.

If your body is destroyed or damaged beyond the capacity to survive while you are under the effects of this spell, its duration becomes permanent. You are now a {@creature Ghost|XMM} until your body is targeted by an effect that returns the living to the dead such as {@spell Raise Dead|XPHB} or {@spell Resurrection|XPHB}.

spell.name: Maelfa's Quickened Class
entries: When you cast this spell, you give an abbreviated lecture on a topic of your choosing to 10 willing creatures of your choice within range. When you do so, choose one spell you know or have prepared, one skill you are proficient in, or one language you can speak, read, and write. Each chosen creature is temporarily imparted with a portion of your knowledge.

If you chose a spell, each creature prepares the spell, the spell is considered on the creature's spell list, and it doesn't count against the creature's number of prepared spells. If you chose a skill, each targeted creature gains proficiency in that skill. If you chose a language, each targeted creature can speak, read, and write that language.

The creature loses the knowledge of the spell, proficiency, or language when this spell ends. If a creature is targeted by this spell while under the effect of a previous casting of the spell, the previous casting immediately ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The duration of the spell increases with a spell slot level of 3 or 4 (30 days), 5 or 6 (10 days), 7 or 8 (30 days), or 9 (1 year).

spell.name: Magic Mirror

time.condition: which you take when you are targeted by a spell

entries: A momentary bubble of iridescent energy shimmers in the air between you and a foe. The triggering spell is redirected to a creature of your choice you can see within 60 feet. If the spell is level 5 or lower, you are no longer a target of the spell and the chosen creature is instead. If the spell is level 6 or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus the spell's level). On a successful check, you are no longer a target of the spell and the chosen creature is instead. On a failed check, you remain the target of the triggering spell.

spell.name: Melting Curse
entries: You target a creature and a metal object held or worn by that creature you can see within range. The creature makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d8} Fire damage and the targeted object melts and oozes to the ground, where it returns to its normal shape and temperature. If the object is magical, the creature has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.

If the creature tries to retrieve or otherwise touch the object for the duration, the object heats and melts, and the creature takes {@damage 5d8} Fire damage. The object returns to normal once the creature is no longer touching it or the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Mirror Spell

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

entries: You attempt to copy and cast a spell of level 3 or lower that you can see being cast. You can only copy spells cast by creatures, and you can't copy your own spell.

If the triggering spell is level 2 or lower, you automatically copy and cast the spell. If the spell is level 3 or higher, you must succeed on an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus the triggering spell's level) to copy and cast the spell.

When casting a copied spell, you don't expend a spell slot and you don't need any components. Treat the spell as if you were its original caster, using your own spellcasting ability modifier and save DC, and casting it at the lowest level it can be cast.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Treat the level of the spell slot used as the maximum level of spell you can copy and cast.

spell.name: Mortality

m.text: the skull of a humanoid encrusted in gems worth 200+ GP

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend five {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended, then choose an Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, or Fiend within range and condemn it to a taste of mortality. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum and current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} are reduced by the amount rolled on the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell.

For the duration of the spell, a creature that fails the saving throw loses all damage Immunities and Resistances, its creature type changes to Humanoid, and it takes an additional {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage each time it takes damage.

If a creature affected by this spell is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, these changes become permanent and the creature dies. This final effect of the spell can only be reversed if the creature is restored to life and targeted by a Remove {@variantrule Curses|XPHB|Curse} spell or similar magic.

spell.name: Neutralize Aura
entries: You touch a willing creature and neutralize its aura. Until the spell ends, the target can't be perceived by Fey, Fiends, Celestials, and Undead.
The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, casts a spell, or moves within 5 feet of one of the creature types.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Overgrow
entries: When you cast this spell, choose a creature or an object within range that is Huge or smaller and not being worn or carried within range. Vibrant vines quickly grow around the target, pinning it into place and making it easier to traverse.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the spell ends. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition on a success.

If the target is an object, it can't be moved from its current location and creatures that climb the object don't spend extra movement. A creature can make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC to wrest the object out of the vines so it can be moved. If the object is too heavy for the creature to move, this action fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can choose an additional target for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Perfection
entries: You speak a holy word and remake a creature you can see in the image of the Arch Seraphs. The {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on the creature ends, curses on the target are suppressed for the spell's duration, and it is restored to its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum. The creature's ability scores less than 18 become 18. Depending on the word you use, you also bless the target based upon the Arch Seraph that you call upon:

entries.name: Aphaelon:
entries: The target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition. If the target fails a saving throw, it can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause the save to be rerolled. It must use the new roll.

entries.name: Empyreus:
entries: The target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, and the target deals an extra {@damage 4d6} Force damage to the first target it hits on each of its turns.

entries.name: Miklas:
entries: The target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage and the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, and it regains {@dice 4d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Morael:
entries: The target gains 30 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. When an ally within 60 feet of the target takes damage, the target can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to take the damage instead.

entries.name: Solyma:
entries: The target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Thunder damage. When the target takes damage from a creature it can see, it can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to deal Fire damage to that creature equal to the triggering damage.

entries.name: Zabriel:
entries: The target gains {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. At the end of each of its turn, the target can award {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} to an ally that doesn't have it.

spell.name: Phoenix Flames
entries: You immolate yourself, consuming your body in a searing cloud of holy flames. You are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and die, and burning radiance erupts from you in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 30d6} Radiant damage and gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it and everything nonmagical it is wearing and carrying are incinerated. The target can be revived only by a True Resurrection or a Wish spell.
After 10 minutes, you rise from the ashes where you originally cast the spell. You return to life as if you were targeted by a True Resurrection spell.

spell.name: Power Word Maim
entries: You command the body of a creature to twist and warp.
