If the target has 125 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or fewer, it takes {@damage 8d10} Necrotic damage, and it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. Otherwise, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the start of your next turn. The target makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.

spell.name: Preserve

components.m: a sack containing a pinch of salt

entries: Food and other perishable items weighing 5 pounds or less that you place in a sack don't age or decay for the duration.

spell.name: Primordial Power
entries: When you cast this spell, grant a creature in range a portion of the power of the elementals. For the duration, the creature can speak and understand Primordial and gains additional benefits based on the element you choose when you cast the spell:

items.name: Air
entries: The target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Lightning and Thunder damage. In addition, it has a Fly speed of 30 feet.

items.name: Coldfire
entries: The target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage. In addition, it can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to expend a {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die, regaining a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the numbered rolled plus its Constitution modifier. When the target takes Fire damage, it can't use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its next turn.

items.name: Earth
entries: The target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against being moved or knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB}. In addition, it has {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet.

items.name: Fire
entries: The target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage. In addition, when the target takes damage from a creature that is within 5 feet of it, it can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one melee attack against that creature, using a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

items.name: Water
entries: The target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Acid damage. In addition, it can breathe underwater and has a Swim speed of 60 feet.

spell.name: Reanimate

m.text: a mlange of wilted daisies and other herbal powders worth 300+ GP, which this spell consumes

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. You touch a creature that has died within the last 10 minutes and return it to life with 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}. In addition, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell, and the creature gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll.

At the start of each of the target's turns, it loses 1 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB|Temporary Hit Point} granted by this spell. While the creature has {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by this spell, it moves with unnatural vigor, gaining a +2 bonus to {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}. Once it loses the {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by this spell, the creature gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.
This spell can't revive a creature that has died of old age, nor does it restore any missing body parts.

spell.name: Red Rain
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend eight {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Over the course of {@dice 1d6} times 5 minutes, the sky darkens and thick droplets of blood rain everywhere within 5 miles of you.

Each Beast and Plant creature in the area must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until it has spent 1 minute outside the area. Mundane plants exposed to the rain wither and die after 10 minutes.

For every 10 minutes that a creature of any type is directly exposed to the rain, that creature gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level and takes {@damage 2d10} Necrotic damage. The creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage dealt. This reduction lasts until the creature removes all levels of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} gained from this spell. While a creature has any {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels from this spell, it automatically fails saving throws against removing the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

When the spell ends, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell. Beast and Plant creatures won't return and plants won't regrow in the area for a number of days equal to the roll's total.

spell.name: Ride the Lightning
entries: You transform yourself into a bolt of lightning, creating a 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} between your current space and an unoccupied space within 60 feet of you. Each creature in the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. You then reappear in the chosen space.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 4. In addition, the maximum length of the line increases 10 feet for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Sanguine Fusillade

components.m: a needle dipped in your blood

entries: You crystalize your foe's blood into razor darts that burst forth to strike your enemies. As part of casting this spell, you must expend seven {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell. Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target takes Piercing damage equal to the roll. When a creature takes this damage, seven crimson darts burst from it.

You can direct each dart to hit a creature within 60 feet of the original target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several, including the original target. For each dart, make a ranged spell attack against the chosen creature. On a hit, roll one {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die expended to cast the spell, and the creature takes Piercing damage equal to the number rolled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend an additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die and create another dart for each spell slot level above 7.

spell.name: Sanguine Poppet

m.text: an object shaped like a creature worth 1+ CP

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. You smear the spell's Material component with your blood. The object shudders and becomes a poppet under your control.

The poppet's AC equals 10 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and your spellcasting ability modifier, and it has 30 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. If your poppet is ever reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or it is more than 1 mile away, the spell ends immediately. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can command your poppet to move 30 feet, and you can see and hear through it until the start of your next turn.

As a Magic action, you can cause the poppet to detonate in an explosion of blood, ending this spell. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast this spell. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on the poppet makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking Necrotic damage equal to the roll on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend an additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die for each spell slot level above 3. Additionally, the duration of this spell increases by 1 hour for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Sanguine Shield
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. You draw lifeforce from those injured around you to create a swirling shield of blood. You gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} for each creature within 30 feet of you that is below its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum (including you) to a maximum of 15 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. While you have {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} from this spell, you have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover}. When the spell ends, all {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} from it are lost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The maximum number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} you gain increases by 5 for each two spell slot levels above 2.

spell.name: Seal Spellcasting

components.m: wax mixed with lead and a stamp

entries: When you cast this spell, choose a creature you can see within range. When the target casts a spell, it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature expends a spell slot to cast the spell as normal but the spell has no effect. On a successful save, the creature casts the spell but takes {@damage 3d8} Force damage. After the creature makes a saving throw, the spell immediately ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot above level 2.

spell.name: Sense Lifeblood
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. The lifeblood flowing within creatures tells you its secrets. Creatures that have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition are immune to this spell. Until the spell ends, you can determine if creatures you can see are related biologically. In addition, you know if a creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} are at maximum, below maximum, at half, or below half.

Once on each of your turns when you hit a {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creature with an attack roll using a weapon, {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, or spell, you can cause the target to take extra Necrotic. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Your {@status Concentration|XPHB} can last longer with a spell slot of level 3-4 (up to 1 hour) or 5+ (up to 8 hours).

spell.name: Serpent Tongue
entries: You transform your tongue into a poisonous serpent for the duration. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 10 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} Piercing damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for every spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Shared Judgement
entries: Once on each of your turns when you reduce an Undead to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can deal {@damage 5d6} Radiant damage to a creature you can see within 60 feet of you no action required.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Shroud Blood
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die or the spell automatically fails.  You can choose yourself or a willing creature within 30 feet of yourself to have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks. When the target loses the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition, it can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition for a number of rounds equal to the number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell. The target loses the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition immediately after it makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target an additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Somnolence

components.m: sand mixed with the spellcaster's blood

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die expended to cast the spell plus {@dice 2d12} and choose a creature within range. If the roll's total is equal to or greater than the chosen creature's current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the creature falls into a magical slumber for 1 minute. If the roll's total is equal to or greater than the chosen creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum, the magical slumber lasts for 24 hours instead. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell's effect. A creature woken early from this spell gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.
Creatures that don't sleep, such as elves, or that have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition automatically succeed on saves against this spell.

entries.name: The Long Sleep
entries: Adherents of the Prismatic Circle perform a variation of the Somnolence spell that takes 10 minutes and requires the sacrifice of a Humanoid. These adherents believe when the ritual is completed, it staves off the waking of Gormadraug for a day and night. Through the repetitive performance of this ritual, the Druids of the Prismatic Circle hope to ensure Gormadraug slumbers forever.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You roll an additional {@dice 1d12} and can expend an additional two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} for every spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Spirit Swarm
entries: You invite spirits to take their revenge upon a target. A creature you can see within range must make a Charisma saving throw. The target must have a Charisma of 3 or higher. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d8} Psychic damage and has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the spell ends. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

spell.name: Splattering Smite

time.note: which you take when you hit a creature with a Melee weapon

entries: Your strikes drink the splattered blood of your foes. As part of casting this spell, you must expend five Hit Dice or the spell automatically fails. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the numbered rolled.

spell.name: Steal Immortality

time.condition: which you take when a Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within range that you can see is reduced to 0 Hit Points

m.text: the skull of a humanoid encrusted in gems worth 1,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend nine {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell and gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice the roll's total. You gain the creature type of the spell's target, in addition to your own type.

While the spell lasts, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition; you no longer need to eat, drink, or breathe; you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; and you gain a benefit based on your new creature type:

entries.name: Celestial
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Radiant and Necrotic damage and have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.

entries.name: Elemental
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, and Thunder damage.

entries.name: Fey
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn, or teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entries.name: Fiend
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold and Fire damage and have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.

entries.name: Undead
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic damage, and you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.
You have the creature type and benefits until you cast the spell again, or you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

spell.name: Suffocate
entries: You create a pair of grasping hands made from {@condition invisible} force. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see within range. On a hit, the creature has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. While it has this condition, it can't breathe.

A creature can hold its breath for a number of rounds equal to 1 plus its Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 seconds) before suffocation begins. When a creature runs out of breath, it gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level at the end of each of its turns. When a creature can breathe again, it removes all levels of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} it gained from suffocating.

A creature {@condition Restrained|XPHB} by the hands can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition Restrained|XPHB}.

entries.name: Casting Time:
entries: {@variantrule Action|XPHB}

entries.name: Range:
entries: 90 feet

entries.name: Components:
entries: V, S, M (a ceramic pot filled with herbs and fertilizer worth at least 200 GP)

entries.name: Duration:
entries: {@status Concentration|XPHB}, up to 1 hour You call forth a plant spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Plant Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose a floral feature: Blooming, Oaken, or Thorny. The creature resembles an animated plant marked by the chosen floral feature, which determines one of the traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Summon Sea Spirit

m.text: a bejeweled statuette of a sea serpent worth at least 300 GP

entries: You call forth an abyssal spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Sea Serpent stat block. When you cast the spell, choose an abhorrent feature: Enormous Mouth, Glowing Lantern, or Scaled Wings. The creature resembles a monstrous sea creature marked by the chosen abhorrent feature, which determines one of the traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Supernal Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: Your strike cause ambient magic surrounded a creature to collapse and detonate. The target hit by the strike takes an extra {@damage 4d6} Force damage from the attack. If the creature is {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell, that {@status Concentration|XPHB} is broken.

In addition, each ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

spell.name: Theft of Vitae

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage

entries: Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell. The triggering creature takes Necrotic damage equal to the result. You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the result plus the triggering damage, to a maximum of 15 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The maximum number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} you can gain from casting increases by 10 for each slot level above 2.

spell.name: Thorn Armor
entries: When you cast this spell, a flexible exoskeleton covered in thorns appears around a willing target within range. The target gains {@dice 3d6} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. If a creature hits the target with a melee attack roll before the spell ends, that creature takes Piercing damage equal to the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} lost as a result of the attack. This spell ends early if the target has no remaining {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The target gains an additional {@dice 2d6} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Tremor
entries: The ground around you in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} begins to shake violently. You are unaffected by the tremors. The ground is considered {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} and whenever the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} enters a creature's space, a creature enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, or the creature ends its turn there, the creature makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} Bludgeoning damage and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Undead Enthrallment

components.m: a clay pot filled with brackish water, another clay pot filled with grave dirt, and a black onyx stone worth 500 + GP for each corpse

entries: Choose a corpse, or a number or corpses, within range that are equivalent to the size of the creature you are animating (the GM determines how many corpses are required). Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an Undead creature. You can choose for the target to become an Undead creature of CR 3 or lower (the GM has the creature's game statistics).

On each of your turns, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you. (If you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one.) You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over 1 creature you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one. Any creature you have maintained with this spell for 30 days remains permanently under your control. You may only control a maximum of four creatures with this spell.

spell.name: Vampiric Claws
entries: You sprout wicked claws. When you use your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} to deal damage with the new growth, it deals {@damage 1d6} Slashing damage instead of dealing the normal damage for your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, and you use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls rather than using Strength.

While the spell lasts, each time you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} from the spell are lost when the spell ends.

spell.name: Vibrating Humors
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one Hit Die or the spell automatically fails. A creature you can see within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes Thunder damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks from its blood vibrating loudly. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die expended to cast this spell.
The target repeats the save at the end of each of turns, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You increase the damage by expending an additional Hit Die for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Viscous Sheath
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend seven Hit Dice or the spell automatically fails. Your body is wrapped in clotted blood. Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack roll, the attacker takes Necrotic damage. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

If a creature hits you with a Melee weapon, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to have clots form around the weapon, entrapping it. The attacker must succeed on a Strength saving throw or the weapon sticks to you. If the attacker doesn't release the weapon, the creature has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition while the weapon is stuck. While stuck, the weapon can't be used. The target can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC, freeing the weapon on a success. The creature can also release the weapon to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition.
You can trap a number of weapons equal to the number of Hit Dice expended to cast the spell. When the spell ends, the weapons are released.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can trap an additional weapon for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Wall of Gloom
entries: You create a wall of swirling gray energy, formed of the psychic pain of loss. The wall appears within range on a solid surface and lasts for the duration. You choose to make the wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick or a ringed wall that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight.

The wall sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} out to a range of 100 feet. When you cast the spell, you and creatures you designate can pass through and remain near the wall without harm. If a creature moves within 20 feet of it or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn.

A creature can move through the wall, though the attempt is emotionally draining. The first time a creature enters the wall on a turn or ends its turn there, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.

spell.name: Weave Numen

m.text: a mithral sewing needle worth 300 GP+, which the spell consumes

entries: You can sense the presence of magic within 120 feet of yourself. You see a faint aura around any visible creature or object within that range that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.
In addition, you gain thirteen threads. You can spend these threads to gain benefits as described below, with no action required unless stated:

items: When you cast a spell, you can expend 1 thread to enhance the spell as if you had expended a spell slot 1 level higher than you did and you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 1 plus the level of the spell.

When a creature you can see within 120 feet of you casts a spell, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend 1 thread to interrupt that spell. If it's a spell of level 3 or lower, the spell fails and has no effect. If it's a spell of level 4 or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC equals 10 plus the spell's level). On a successful check, the spell fails and has no effect.

When you cast a spell that causes a creature to be healed or take damage, you can spend up to six threads. The amount of damage or healing caused to one creature by that spell increases by four times the number of expended threads.

entries: You lose all remaining threads when this spell ends. If you spend all threads granted by the spell, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You gain an additional two threads per spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Wilting Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. The creature loses all Resistances to damage until the start of your next turn. The target hit by the strike takes extra Necrotic damage from the attack. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell.

spell.name: Wipe Face
entries: You curse a creature that you can see within range. The target's face is replaced with completely smooth skin, sealing the creature's eyes, nose, and mouth. The creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} conditions and begins suffocating.

At the end of each of its turns, the target can attempt a Constitution saving throw to end the spell. Dealing at least 15 Slashing damage to the target opens an airway allowing it to breathe, but  the curse seals the opening at the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Wrack
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with excruciating muscle spasms for the duration. On a failed save, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.
